intro: Belmontia cordata var. micrantha, commonly known as the small-leaved belmontia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Araceae family, characterized by its inflorescence consisting of a spadix surrounded by a modified leaf called a spathe. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte or terrestrial herb, often found in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are heart-shaped and relatively small, with a smooth texture and a deep green color. The flowers are usually white or pale yellow, contributing to its ornamental value in horticulture.
